name: preponderated
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
preponderate
to be more important or larger in size or number than other people or things in a group: Although it was a mixed class, girls preponderated. The evidence preponderates heavily against the verdict. See
preponderant
More examplesFewer examplesA sense of general happiness preponderated.They gave his statement a preponderating importance which it did not really possess.Middle-aged or elderly patients preponderated on the ward.
